snippet: As shelling in the Damascus suburbs worsened, the United Nations warned that it was getting harder to get food to displaced Syrians.
abstract: Syrian forces continue to press intense counteroffensive against rebels in Damascus suburbs, as government blames rebels for mortar attack that hit school; United Nations warns that increasingly dangerous situation in country is making it hard to provide enough food to displaced Syrians.

byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, and Christine Hauser from New York.

lead_paragraph: As shelling in the Damascus suburbs worsened, the United Nations warned that it was getting harder to get food to displaced Syrians.

headline.seo: Mortar Attack Kills at Least 9 People at Syrian School
headline.main: Amid Syrian Violence, School Is Hit and U.N. Says Food Shortages Worsen
headline.print_headline: Amid Syrian Violence, School Is Hit and U.N. Says Food Shortages Worsen

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
